content: If you have emptied trash, they are likely gone. It appears you use IMAP and when a message is deleted from one device, it's deleted from all.
creator: davidsk

content: Se stai usando IMAP, la cartelle grigie sono cartelle che non contengono messaggi ma solo sotto-cartelle. Per non farle comparire basta deleselezionarle dalla sincronizzazione -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/sincronizzazione-imap#w_configurazione-della-sincronizzazione-ed-utilizzo-dello-spazio-sul-disco
creator: @next

content:
Probabilmente il modo più semplice è installare in entrambe le versioni di Thunderbird l'estensione ImportExportTools NG -> https://addons.thunderbird.net/it/thunderbird/addon/importexporttools-ng/

Va poi usata per esportare la posta da un PC ed importarla nell'altro. Tra i vari formati supportati, usa quello denominato mbox. L'importazione delle email falla in una cartella sotto Cartelle locali di Thunderbird e non in una cartella sotto l'account TIM.
creator: @next

content: Se, come scrivi, il server non scarica la posta, devi palare con chi amministra il server... Se invece è Thunderbird a non scaricare la posta, riporta esattamente i messaggi di errore che compaiono quando provi a scaricare la posta.
creator: @next

content: Puzzling. To me, the screenshot indicates that the unified Sent folder includes one gmail account and that you have selected only one account. The screen shows you selected the Sent folder, yet on my PC, the sent folder for gmail is 'Sent Mail.' Maybe a different screenshot will help.
creator: davidsk

content:
Hi David: Thanks for the quick reply. There is no other SENT option available such as SENT MAIL in the properties settings. I can't send an expanded screenshot since the stingy settings screen only allows one line at a time to show.

As a test, I changed my unified DRAFTS folder settings to instead select the account's SENT folder, and it worked as expected by pulling in the contents of the account's SENT folder into the unified DRAFTS folder. I next reversed the test by changing the unified SENT folder settings to instead select the account's DRAFTS folder, and that worked as expected since all the account's draft messages showed in the unified SENT folder. The unified settings seem to work for other folders but not the correct ones! This seems to show that the account and unified folder's themselves aren't the problem. I'm thinking there's some sort of hinky technical bug at work here. What do you think?
creator: James-A

content: Okay. I've solved it! The problem was that the UNREAD filter was turned on for the unified SENT folder for some reason. This had the effect of filtering out all the messages without any indication that this was happening. By simply removing this filter setting, I was able see all the messages in the unified SENT folder as expected. The tests above worked since the DRAFTS messages were unread. However, I noticed 3 messages in DRAFTS were 'read' and that's what clued me in to what was going on when I re-did the tests and noticed 3 draft messages were missing in the unified SENT folder. So.......problem solved. Thanks for your help. ps if you don't mind a personal comment, your account picture shows you're one smart canine.
creator: James-A

content: You're welcome. I'm glad it worked out well, and that you figured it out. That is a photo of our dear yorkie, who was with us for 12 years. We lost her six years ago. Nice memories remain. :)
creator: davidsk

content:
Hi There are three situations for Threaded situations which can occur and this is how they display:

1. If you receive two new emails that are threaded and this is a new Subject and thread is collapsed then you should see: top level thread - White bold font and new yellow star on left of subject If expanded then it should show an additional threaded email with white bold font and 'new' star.

2. If you have a thread which has been receiving additional emails in the thread and there is a newly added email to thread OR email is not new but it is unread then you will see: top level email is normal font because top level email is not new, but it should be 'underlined' to indicate it contains a new and or unread email. When thread expanded the new email itself will be white bold font and yellow new star, but any that are not new but are unread will be bold white font - no star.

3. If you have collapsed thread which has no new mails then it will be: top level email white normal font - not bold and not underlined.

Additional: If a single email not threaded: If new - white bold font and yellow star If not new but unread - white bold font If read - normal white font.


Your situation seems to imply you are discussing number 2. In which case top level emails are underlined. So you look for the one which is underlined and expand it.

OR You could use the quick method: Use the 'Quick Filter' if not enabled: Click on 'Quick Filter' button to see the 'Quick Filter Bar' click on the 'Show only unread messages' envelope icon. Click on same icon again to go back to normal.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Yes, because it is IMAP, she loses nothing. All the messages are on the online server. Yes, if two IMAP accounts on the same PC are the same account, then it's safe to remove one account and lose no messages. I suggest leave the old PC alone and start fresh. If she has an addressbook on the old machine, that can be copied to the new PC. That may not be important, so I won't delve into details unless asked.
creator: davidsk

content:
David, thank you so much for this speedy response:) May i restate what you say to be sure i've grasped it please?

to clarify: 'Yes, if two IMAP accounts on the same PC are the same account',:.....

they both share the same email address but have different names and if i delete the unwanted account on the local machine the server maintains the original copies unless i change this option in settings and any email existing in both accounts on the local machine are not related to each other as such but related only to the server originals. Deletion locally will not affect the server data.

to clarify: " I suggest leave the old PC alone and start fresh"

when i download Thunderbird to the new machine and use the email address applicable to my BT server, only one set of local folders & current messages will appear on the new machine/new Thunderbird app.... because the server is not interested if i have 2 or 10 named accounts with the same email address on the local machine.

We would very much welcome any guidance on migrating the address book.

David, thank you so much
creator: stepphen1
